alert.note: Alert for Gallia (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 10:13PM EST until February 28 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... West Virginia... Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Gallia and Mason Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ohio River At Point Pleasant. * WHEN...Until midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, Low-lying areas surrounding Point Pleasant and vicinity are flooded due to backwater. Also, the ampitheater lower pier is flooded and half way up the steps. Salt Creek Road, Hannan Trace Road, Huntington Road at Boggs Run Road and Mason Eighty Road start to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 40.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM EST Sunday was 40.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 27.4 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 40.1 feet on 05/04/1909. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM EST.
